member.name: M:DashboardControls.SizeControl.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Creates a new run-time sizing control. The sizing control does not become "active" on the design surface at run-time until it has been bound to the control that needs to be sized. (Using the BoundControl property).

member.name: P:DashboardControls.SizeControl.DesignSurface
member.summary: Returns the Design Surface this Sizing control has been bound to. All Sizing operations will be performed within the Design surface context (or child container if sized control is parented to an inner control of the Design Surface control).

member.name: P:DashboardControls.SizeControl.BoundControl
member.summary: Used to set which control should become sizeable. Set this value to nothing to "turn off" sizing functionality or set to a new control to enabled sizing functionality for that control.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.SizeControl.ProximitySnapSize
member.summary: Used to set proximity snapping. Set to 0 to turn proximity snapping off.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.SizeControl.SizingGlyphsSize
member.summary: Used to set the size of the sizing glyphs.

member.name: T:DashboardControls.SizeControl
member.summary: This class is used to enable run-time sizing of controls. Set the design surface as the parent control on your form that will contain all the controls you want to be allow user to resize at run-time. To have a control at runtime become user resizeable, simply set the BoundControl of this class to the control you want.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.LED8Segment.BackgroundType.BackColor1
member.summary: Defines the Background color of the gauge when is set to Solid. Otherwise is used as the first color in a color gradient with the end color determined by the property.
member.value: The Background color of the gauge or the start gradient color of background.

member.name: M:DashboardControls.LED8Segment.BackgroundType.ResetBackColor1
member.summary: Resets the BarGauge.BackColor1 property.

member.name: M:DashboardControls.LED8Segment.BackgroundType.ShouldSerializeBackColor1
member.summary: Indicates whether the default value of the property has changed from it's default in design mode and needs to be serialized.

member.summary: The Text of the label.

member.summary: The Text alignment for this label.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.RotatedLabelImage.RotationAngle
member.summary: The rotation angle for this label.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.RotatedLabelImage.TransparentColor
member.summary: The color that is used for transparency.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.RotatedLabelImage.MinHeight
member.summary: The minimum height of this label.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.RotatedLabelImage.MinWidth
member.summary: The minimum width of this label.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.RotatedLabelImage.FillStyle
member.summary: The FillStyle of this label.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.RotatedLabelImage.FillGradientStyle
member.summary: The fill gradient orientation for this label if the FillStyle has been set to a gradient mode.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.RotatedLabelImage.FillBackColor0
member.summary: Color used for creating background color for this image. Used as the Solid fill background color or as the start color in gradient fills.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.RotatedLabelImage.FillBackColor1
member.summary: Secondary color used when label background is a gradient fill. Ignored if the fill type is set to solid.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.RotatedLabelImage.Size
member.summary: The bounding rectangle Size of the label after rotation.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.RotatedLabelImage.Bitmap
member.summary: Returns a bitmap of the rotated label.

member.name: M:DashboardControls.RotatedLabelImage.SaveToFile(System.String,System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat)
member.summary: Saves the rotated label to a file using specified file format.

member.name: T:DashboardControls.RotatedLabelImage
member.summary: Class used to generate bitmaps of rotated text labels. Full support for fonts, background fills, transparency, etc. To use, set all the settings you need and then use the Bitmap property of this class to retrieve a bitmap or call the SaveToFile method to save the bitmap to a file in a format of your choice (bmp, png, etc).

member.name: M:DashboardControls.MultiBarGauge.RefreshGauge
member.summary: Forces the gauge display to refresh.

member.summary: Defines the Background color of the gauge when is set to Solid. Otherwise is used as the first color in a color gradient with the end color determined by the property.
member.value: The Background color of the gauge or the start gradient color of background.

member.name: M:DashboardControls.MultiBarGauge.BackgroundType.ResetBackColor1
member.summary: Resets the BarGauge.BackColor1 property.

member.name: M:DashboardControls.MultiBarGauge.BackgroundType.ShouldSerializeBackColor1

member.name: M:DashboardControls.MoveControl.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Creates a new run-time Moving control. The moving control does not become "active" on the design surface at run-time until it has been bound to the control that needs to be moved. (Using the BoundControl property).

member.name: P:DashboardControls.MoveControl.DesignSurface
member.summary: Returns the Design Surface this Moving control has been bound to. All Move operations will be performed within the Design surface context.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.MoveControl.BoundControl
member.summary: Used to set which control should become moveable. Set this value to nothing to "turn off" moving functionality or set to a new control to enable moving functionality for that control.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.MoveControl.ProximitySnapSize
member.summary: Used to set proximity snapping. Set to 0 to turn proximity snapping off.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.MoveControl.MoveGlyphSize
member.summary: Sets the size (in pixels) of the Move glyph that appears at the top left of the control that has been move-enabled (using the BoundControl property)

member.name: P:DashboardControls.MoveControl.MoveGlyphOffset
member.summary: The Move glyph is positioned to the right of the top left corner of the move-enabled control. This offset determines how far to the right of that top left corner the Move glyph should be positioned.

member.name: T:DashboardControls.MoveControl
member.summary: This class is used to enable run-time moving of controls. Set the design surface as the parent control on your form that will contain all the controls you want to be allow user to move at run-time. The DesignSurface you set will essentially limit the user to only move control within that design surface. To have a control at runtime become user moveable, simply set the BoundControl of this class to the control you want. Note that this class supports reparenting of moved controls. To allow other controls on your design surface to capture a control when it is moved there, set those controls' AllowDrop property to True.

member.name: P:DashboardControls.RotatedLabel.BackgroundType.BackColor1
member.summary: Defines the Background color of the gauge when is set to Solid. Otherwise is used as the first color in a color gradient with the end color determined by the property.
member.value: The Background color of the gauge or the start gradient color of background.

member.name: M:DashboardControls.RotatedLabel.BackgroundType.ResetBackColor1
member.summary: Resets the BarGauge.BackColor1 property.

member.name: M:DashboardControls.RotatedLabel.BackgroundType.ShouldSerializeBackColor1
member.summary: Indicates whether the default value of the property has changed from it's default in design mode and needs to be serialized.

member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to .

member.name: M:DashboardControls.Utilities.LoadSingleInstanceForm(System.Windows.Forms.Form@,System.Windows.Forms.Form@)
member.summary: This function can be used to instantiate a single instance form. If form already exists, it is displayed, otherwise it is first instantiated and then displayed.
member.param: A form object to be instantiated.
If form should be created as a child form of an MDI container, specify the MDI container using this parameter. Set parameter to Nothing if an MDI child form is not required.
member.remarks: This function does not support passing parameters to the form constructor. Form must have a default parameter-less constructor available.

member.summary: Library of various useful functions.

member.name: T:DashboardControls.BarGauge.HeatLevel.HeatLevelStyles
member.summary: Defines the style of Heat Level to use in the Bar Gauge.
member.remarks:
Use in conjunction with the HeatLevel Start/End Colors and threshold Values/Colors.
Note:When using a single Heat Level, only the Left heat level properties will be used to define that heat level.
